summary: App for packed drinking water in glass bottle business — likely a product/inventory or ordering app for bottled water.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Bright hero banner with clear glass water bottles arranged neatly on a white surface with light aqua water droplets and subtle light reflections (hero-banner.dim_1200x400.png)
- Single clear glass water bottle with clean label, crisp water inside, on a white background with soft shadow (bottle-illustration.dim_400x400.png)

existing_features.title: Build a frontend product catalog page that displays all available packed drinking water glass bottle products in a card grid. Each card shows the bottle image, name, volume, price, and stock level with an 'Add to Order' button.
Build a frontend order placement flow with a cart/order summary panel. Users can adjust quantities, enter customer name and contact, and submit the order. Show a success confirmation after placement.

Build a frontend admin dashboard with two tabs: Products (add/edit/delete products and manage stock) and Orders (list all orders, filter by status, and update order status). Protect admin actions with a simple admin mode toggle.

Apply a clean, fresh visual theme inspired by pure water and glass — use a crisp white and light aqua/teal color palette, minimal sans-serif typography, soft shadows, and subtle glass-like card effects. Maintain this theme consistently across all pages.
Render the generated product hero image and bottle illustration as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated and use them on the landing/product pages.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a backend actor that manages a product catalog of packed drinking water glass bottle products, each with fields: id, name, description, volume (ml), pricePerUnit, stockQuantity, and isAvailable. Provide functions to add, update, delete, and list products.

Create a backend order management system. Each order includes: orderId, customerName, customerContact, items (array of productId + quantity), totalPrice, status (pending/confirmed/delivered/cancelled), and createdAt timestamp. Provide functions to place an order, update order status, and list all orders.
